Gracias a todos los que se preocuparon por lo de los tipos de migracin de Santo Domingo. En especial gracias a Luigino por hacer de mi caso todo un reportaje en su blog (y que eventualmente apareci tambin en Aporrea). Gracias a todos los que han dejado mensajes de apoyo en los comentarios del post. Gracias a los comentarios tambin vertidos en el blog de bureado (aunque aclaro que yo nunca habl mal del gobierno o gente de Venezuela, ni mucho menos dije que Mxico es un edn de la no corrupcin y la vida justa y equitativa), as como quienes escribieron los suyos propios en el blog de Luigino. Tambin gracias a quienes me contactaron va IRC o MSN. Finalmente, con la dignidad por delante, esos hijos de la chingada me hicieron lo que el viento a Jurez, y si se intenta hacer otra vez, ya sabr cmo defenderme por la vida diplomtica. Por cierto, Luigino, no volv a Mxico: Estoy residiendo en Caracas actualmente.

El martes pasado fui con Manuel a la calle del hambre, por unos rumbos llamados La Trinidad. Bonito lugar, me haca recordar un poco las Interlonas, de Santa Fe, donde todos los oficinistas coman comida chatarra. Comimos arepas y tomamos unas ricas Solera azules y empezamos a ver el partido de bisbol de Venezuela contra Repblica Dominicana. Mi pap sera feliz en un pas como ste donde reina el bisbol, la gente se junta a verlo en todos lados, el trfico se agiliza cuando juega la seleccin venezolana “vinotinto”, se escuchan gritos y reacciones en los vecindarios. Igualito como cuando juega el tri en un Mundial. Lamentablemente Venezuela termin eliminada del Clsico Mundial y hoy toca el turno a Mxico con la oportunidad de pasar a semifinales si derrota con un buen margen a Estados Unidos debido a que el resultado de Corea-Japn le satisfizo a Mxico que perdi con sendos pases asiticos.

Jos y yo hemos estado jugando un poco con una vaina que bautizamos g33k. g33k es… es… no s que es, pero algo es. Es como para aprender y perder el tiempo hackeando pendejada y media, explorer y conocer cosillas. Por el momento hemos montado un par de cosas interesantes, un jabberd pblico (basta con registrarse libremente con cualquier cliente), un servidor de llaves pblico, un servidor ntp, etc. Ha sido bastante entretenido y hemos podido jugar con varias cosas. Personalmente me satisface jugar con Cherokee y backportear algunas cosas a Etch. Tenemos algunos proyectos extras que quizs sea interesante lanzar a futuro. Creo que podremos hacer grandes cosas, o bueno, no grandes, pero al menos interesantes :) La renta de un servidor dedicado para ofrecer servicios de hospedaje y alojamiento de nuestros proyectos es algo que suena sumamente tentador e inminente ya.

Ana viene a Caracas el prximo lunes. Ir a recogerla, ya no puedo esperar para estar con ella otra vez. Estando ella aqu iremos a ver lo de su boleto en Taca para ir a DebConf6. Viene, por cierto, porque dar una charla en la UPEL Maracay.

Cmo se va el tiempo, ya llevo aqu medio mes y a veces siento que no me he desenvuelto lo suficiente, me gustara poder programar ms, desarrollar ms los proyectos que hay pendientes, dedicarme a eso y al trabajo de Nekotec y Merkurio. Me gustara poder leer ms, tengo algunos libros en cola y de plano siento que a veces se me va el avin en cualquier estupidez.

Ya le estoy agarrando cario a la comida venezolana. Lo que ms me gusta son principalmente tres cosas: Tajada, cachapas y Hit de uva :) Explico. La tajada es simplemente pltano macho frito y rebanado verticalmente. El pltano macho aqu es bastante ms consistente y no tan aguado como a veces es en Mxico, y va con todo. Podra comerme una pizza de tajada y sabra rica ;) Las cachapas son deliciosas. En Mxico existen esos como carritos chiquitos donde te venden hotcakes, pues los que hace cachapas tienen carritos similares (slo que no tan jodidos como en Mxico :P), con una plancha que huele a mantequilla. La cachapa es como un hotcake, pero con masa de elote, sabe como a pan de elote pero es un hotcake, medio grande. Luego le ponen algo que se hace llamar ‘queso de mano’ que es como queso fresco o queso oaxaca y doblan la cachapa de forma que parece un tacote. Le ponen tantita mantequilla al disco de elote, lo cortan a la mitad (entonces se hacen como dos triangulitos grandes) y te lo dan. Sabe espectacular. Ese queso me gusta mucho (broma local: Soy un queso :P:P). Adems, mucha gente come las cachapas con malta, bebida que yo no conoca hasta llegar aqu. La malta es como una combinacin de cerveza con refresco, pero sin alcohol. Hay muchos anuncios de malta en el bisbol y en espectaculares. La tercera cosa es el Hit de uva, que es simplemente un refresco (me parece que es de Coca Cola) de uva con gas, sabe bastante bien. Hay otro refresco divertido que se llama Freskolita, pero todos le dicen Kolita (aunque si son dos refrescos distintos, por favor, alguien hgame ver mi error :P), el cual es bastante cagado pedir en algn lugar, imagnense el siguiente cuadro: Llegamos a algn lugar a comer y al ordenar las bebidas se le pregunta a la mesera: “Disculpe, seorita, tiene Kolita?”, “triganos Kolitas para todos”, “yo quiero una kolita fra, por favor”. Saquen sus propias conclusiones :)

Supe por medio de Javier Prez, que Panda va a venir a Venezuela. Me pregunt de hecho que si iba a ir. Le dije terminantemente que no y le pas el artculo de Lawaloca donde se ve cmo se piratearon rolas de The Chemical Romance. Por cierto que el podcast de Olallo de esta semana, tambin hace referencia a que Panda suckea arrechamente. Van a presentarse el 31 de marzo y el 1 de abril en Valencia y en Caracas, respectivamente. Pinches changos. Al concierto que s me dan muchas ganas de ir es al de Jamiroquai que estar en el Poliedro de Caracas (que es donde Manu Chao di su concierto gratuito el fin de semana que nos fuimos a Mrida), pero los boletos son encabronadamente caros, casi 200’000 bolos.

Por cierto, el Wada se va a ver a su vieja la Jules el prximo martes a Vancouver, que se fue de intercambio por el Tec. Mucha suerte por all carnal, cudate y disfruta con ella. Estaremos al pendiente :) Y sigue hablando con Ana que, an cuando no lo sabes, me echas la mano. El otro da me dijo: “el Wada piensa igualito que t” ;) Ya luego te cuento.. :)

La vida aqu resulta bastante agradable, aunque s me gustara encontrar un depa chiquito o una habitacin en una especie de residencia estudiantil (aunque no sea estudiante :P) o para extranjeros, o algo as, para ya no darle molestias a Jos, Susana y su esposo. Luego de estar en Mrida estuve bastante deprimido, pero ya todo va saliendo conforme a su paso, me siento bastante animado ahora. Los problemas, finalmente, emocionales o de cualquier tipo hay que saber manejarlos, lidiar con ellos, vivir con ellos y que finalmente le hagan a uno lo que el viento a Jurez :D Mientras tanto, este fin de semana espero que sea divertido. Ser el primero que pase en Caracas y quiero disfrutarlo. El viernes celebraremos con hartas curdas, si alguien se quiere unir, pngase en contacto, mi celular en Caracas es 04125669275. Si alguien me quiere llamar desde Mxico (ojal :P) habr que marcar 00584125669275.

Report para ustedes, yo mero.

Post.title: Lluvia
Post._content:
Llueve y llueve. Llueve y llueve. Creo que hoy fue el da en que se cay por completo el cielo. Me perturba la lluvia y ms cuando voy manejando.

El da de hoy, al bajar de los altos bosques, tom Observatorio. En cierto lugar, suele formarse un charco del tamao de la alberca olmpica. La lluvia era tremenda, mis limpiadores son ya una basura y el desempaador noms no desempaaba eficientemente. Yendo a una ptima velocidad de 35 kilmetros por hora, cruc aquel charco. Un hijodeputa al lado, pas como un blido y me ba completamente, dejndome el parabrisas completamente cubierto por el agua impidindome ver absolutamente nada y yo avanzando, autobandome tambin con el agua que yo mismo levantaba hacia los lados.

Fue un segundo? Sent miedo. Apret los dedos de los pies y abr los ojos ampliamente sin conseguir ver nada, con el agua frente a m, los vidrios empaados e Interpol sonando en las bocinas.

Puta lluvia.

De cualquier forma hoy estuve muy animado por dos grandes bugs que aplast hoy en el curro.

Me voy a la hamaca.

Post.title: LiveJournal
Post._content:
I have received a couple of questions regarding of my use of LiveJournal instead of any other weblog system. It’s quite easy. LiveJournal is a free software company, using free software to build a business. That’s widely cool, they are not the same kind of company that allows you to store a webservice and then gets yourself deep on spam. That’s ethic. But, why am I using LiveJournal web service instead of jaws, *Nuke or other web logs? Because I’m lazy to maintain a web site for my own. That’s well shown on damog.net cover page ;-) I installed jaws some days ago, here. I like it, but not too much, I really prefer to have something that I like the most, not just use because it was developed in Mexico, or by some friends: That’s the truth. I don’t like it to be so related to some stuff that nobody cares, but the developers (MVC, ERP, SOAP, etc, etc, etc…). It’s obviously a personal opinion. Some weeks ago, I installed also Mambo to use it more like a organization framework, here. It is extremely beautiful, those guys from graphic design rock, exploding lots of great features of JavaScript and web development. Any way, I just changed the layout of my LiveJournal’s weblog. I like it, as I did with Live365, I would probably buy a paid account, to support a little bit. What they say in their Paid Accounts page is a thought I really share: 

Do I have to pay for using LiveJournal services?
No, of course not. Paying for web services is annoying, we agree.
That's why nearly all of LiveJournal's functionality is available
free of charge. However, if you're happy with the service you're
being provided, show your support and get a paid account.

So, why not? At least, at the end of month, when I receive my check from work ;-)

Current Mood: high Current Music: You’re listening to - Kyoku Radio

Post.title: LiveJournal 2
Post._content:
Es un hecho que me gusta hablar sobre las herramientas que me agradan, para hacer equis cosas, por ye razn.

Realmente no s por qu la gente que tiene blogs y cuya vida est muy relacionada al software libre no usa LiveJournal.

Por qu utilizarlo? Por que desde su pgina principal me siento en casa: LiveJournal is a simple-to-use (but extremely powerful and customizable) personal publishing (“blogging”) tool, built on open source software.

Qu tiene Blogger, que no tenga LiveJournal? Dudo que Blogger u otros ofrezcan tanta posibilidad de modificacin a los blogs. No s.

Es un hecho que otros generadores de blogs usan software libre, pero lo que me gusta de LiveJournal es que adems lo promueve y enaltece su uso.

Y t por qu no usas LiveJournal? ;-)

Current Mood: curious
Current Music: Reel Big Fish - Drunk Again

Post.title: Live 365
Post._content:
Well, I just bought a Preferred Membership of Live365 a few days ago, and I really like it. If you are a close person with me, you’ll know I have no regular music on my PC (aka, mp3). So I began, a few months ago, to listen to Live365 stations, which are really cool. Lots of music, lots of genres, etc. The stations on my profile:

  • Alternative Nation Radio. Great recent music, alternative and rock like.
  • Mejor Pop/Rock Espanol. A bullshit radio station about Latin pop and rock, but it is kinda funny ;-)
  • Ska, Punk and Other Junk. Probably the best radio station on Live365.
  • Ultragroove Live. Beautiful groovie and funkie music.

Live365 is nice. And legal.

Current Mood: okay

Post.title: Listo el pasaporte
Post._content:
Una de las bonitas cosas que tiene la burocracia en este pas es el trmite de pasaportes. Sal de mi casa alrededor de las 10:20 de la maana, mi mam me ech un ride a la oficina de la SRE de la Delegacin Benito Jurez. Llegu con todo listo, incluso fotocopias de mi CURP, fotocopias de mi credencial de elector, etc. Un tipo malencarado me recibe y me pide mi hoja de pago en el banco, mis fotocopias del pasaporte anterior y mis fotografas. No les hizo nada, slo me di la solicitud que tena que llenar a mano en ese momento y me indic la fila donde deba formarme a dar mis documentos.

Este trmite lo he realizado tres veces ya, en el mismo lugar, en la misma oficina. La primera vez fue en el 2004 al sacar un pasaporte por un ao de vigencia, cosa que repet en el 2005, pero como la neta soy demasiado webn y pendejo para andar yendo cada ao y estar pagando ms cada ao (lo barato sale caro), decid pagar al menos un pasaporte por 5 aos. Llen la solicitud OP-5 y me form. Como 25 minutos despus de estar en la fila me dijeron que pasara al mostrador donde entregu mis fotos, mi pasaporte viejo, mis fotocopias, etc. Todo a otro pinche burcrata de mala puta jeta, pero bueno. Me indic que me fuera a sentar en un rea donde me llamaran para tomarme una fotografa a donde fui y me aplast un rato. Luego de unos 10 minutos papaloteando volte a la fila inicial y vi al Wada :), qu agradable sorpresa encontrarlo ah luego de que el sbado nos embriagamos todos juntos en la pedamog de despedida ;)

El pinche Wada, como es un pinche gevn, no busc su pasaporte anterior y asisti a la Delegacin para sacar su pasaporte como si fuera por primera vez. En realidad, en este pas, cuando pierdes un pasaporte tienes que levantar un acta ante el Ministerio Pblico y casi casi tienes que bailar en taparrabos mientras te comes un venado asado y le allas a la luna, para reportar perdido un pasaporte. Segn el Wada ha sacado ya como cinco pasaportes por primera vez, bueno :P. Fui a saludarlo, criticamos a los burcratas en voces bajas y risas sonoras y luego me llamaron para la fotografa, fui, me aplast en la silla y me tomaron la foto. “En dos horas se le entrega su pasaporte, joven”, dijo la gorda que estaba del otro lado de la computadora y de la cmara. “Y dnde me lo dan?”, cosa que inquir an cuando ya lo s, noms para hacrsela cansada a esa vieja. “De aquel ladito, joven”, apuntando hacia el extremo oriental de la oficina. “Hjole, hasta dentro de dos horas?”, para joderla un poco ms. “S, joven”, perdiendo un poco la paciencia. “Gracias, doa”. “Por nada, joven”.

Volv con el Wada y lo acompa a dejar sus papeles y a esperar el turno de la fotografa. Alrededor de las 11:30 estbamos saliendo de la oficina para hacernos pendejos durante dos horas para que nos dieran los pasaportes. Le dije al Wada que si no me acompaaba a la Comercial Mexicana a hacer unas compras que an tena que hacer para llevar a Venezuela, como no le quedaba de otra, nos lanzamos. Fue bien chido encontrarme al Wada ah por que si no, nos hubiramos tenido que picar los putos ojos durante dos horas.

De camino a la Comercial le propuse a ese gey que nos echramos unos tacos para almorzar, pero mejor despus de las compras. Pude comprar un par de cositas, algo de medicina que necesitar estando all, una botella de tequila Corralejo (el que ms me gusta :D) y el Wada se compr un desodorante que segn deca tena varias semanas sin ponerse: Se lo creo.

De regreso nos echamos unos deliciosos tacos de birria con refresquitos. Nos comimos diecisis tacos en total :-$

Casi dos horas despus estbamos de nuevo en la oficina, nos formamos para recibir los pasaportes, rapidito. “Su apellido?”. “Moreno Garza”. Pasaron unos instantes mientras buscaba en una montaa de pasaportes. “David?”. “Para servirle”. “Pase por ac”. Me hizo firmar un papel y ponerle la fecha a un documento. “Aqu tiene”. “Gracias”. Tres horas despus de que llegu a hacer el trmite, ya tena un pasaporte nuevo, con vigencia del 22 de febrero de 2006 al 22 de febrero de 2011. ;) Luego segua el otro chango.

“Apellido?”. “Wadarrama”, bueno, no se apellida exactamente as, pero as lo pronunciara :). “No ha salido, espere unos minutos de aquel lado”. Y estuvimos esperando, criticando a los burcratas en voz baja y con risas sonoras. Salen ms pasaportes y el Wada se acerca.

“Joven, ud. sac un pasaporte anteriormente, no puede sacar otro por primera vez, tiene que levantar un acta en el MP si es que lo perdi”, y con el sentimiento ms naco y tierro contest: “Pero pus ya lo perd, ya”. La burcrata la explica con desgana. “Pero pus ya estaba vencido…”. Finalmente, se la pel y va a tener que ir a hacer un pinche papeleo burocrtico feo :P

Qu bonito es este pas :)

Fui a saludarlo, criticamos a los burcratas en voces bajas y risas sonoras y luego me llamaron para la fotografa, fui, me aplast en la silla y me tomaron la foto. “En dos horas se le entrega su pasaporte, joven”, dijo la gorda que estaba del otro lado de la computadora y de la cmara. “Y dnde me lo dan?”, cosa que inquir an cuando ya lo s, noms para hacrsela cansada a esa vieja. “De aquel ladito, joven”, apuntando hacia el extremo oriental de la oficina. “Hjole, hasta dentro de dos horas?”, para joderla un poco ms. “S, joven”, perdiendo un poco la paciencia. “Gracias, doa”. “Por nada, joven”.

Volv con el Wada y lo acompa a dejar sus papeles y a esperar el turno de la fotografa. Alrededor de las 11:30 estbamos saliendo de la oficina para hacernos pendejos durante dos horas para que nos dieran los pasaportes. Le dije al Wada que si no me acompaaba a la Comercial Mexicana a hacer unas compras que an tena que hacer para llevar a Venezuela, como no le quedaba de otra, nos lanzamos. Fue bien chido encontrarme al Wada ah por que si no, nos hubiramos tenido que picar los putos ojos durante dos horas.

De camino a la Comercial le propuse a ese gey que nos echramos unos tacos para almorzar, pero mejor despus de las compras. Pude comprar un par de cositas, algo de medicina que necesitar estando all, una botella de tequila Corralejo (el que ms me gusta :D) y el Wada se compr un desodorante que segn deca tena varias semanas sin ponerse: Se lo creo.

De regreso nos echamos unos deliciosos tacos de birria con refresquitos. Nos comimos diecisis tacos en total :-$

Casi dos horas despus estbamos de nuevo en la oficina, nos formamos para recibir los pasaportes, rapidito. “Su apellido?”. “Moreno Garza”. Pasaron unos instantes mientras buscaba en una montaa de pasaportes. “David?”. “Para servirle”. “Pase por ac”. Me hizo firmar un papel y ponerle la fecha a un documento. “Aqu tiene”. “Gracias”. Tres horas despus de que llegu a hacer el trmite, ya tena un pasaporte nuevo, con vigencia del 22 de febrero de 2006 al 22 de febrero de 2011. ;) Luego segua el otro chango.

“Apellido?”. “Wadarrama”, bueno, no se apellida exactamente as, pero as lo pronunciara :). “No ha salido, espere unos minutos de aquel lado”. Y estuvimos esperando, criticando a los burcratas en voz baja y con risas sonoras. Salen ms pasaportes y el Wada se acerca.

“Joven, ud. sac un pasaporte anteriormente, no puede sacar otro por primera vez, tiene que levantar un acta en el MP si es que lo perdi”, y con el sentimiento ms naco y tierro contest: “Pero pus ya lo perd, ya”. La burcrata la explica con desgana. “Pero pus ya estaba vencido…”. Finalmente, se la pel y va a tener que ir a hacer un pinche papeleo burocrtico feo :P

Qu bonito es este pas :)

Post.title: linux.org.mx is now Planeta Linux Mxico
Post._content: It's very pleasant for me to announce that the probably most descriptive domain name in Mexico for Linux, linux.org.mx, is now powered by Planeta Linux Mxico. I see this as a great milestone of all the members of the Mexican Linux community that have made Planeta Linux the number one Web site in Mexico for Linux. Also, please raise your drinks for @negrabarba, who made this possible, administrator of the DNS at UPN, where the domain name points to; and of course for Miguel, the owner of it.

Post.title: lib/active_record/base.rb:2808:in `attributes_with_quotes': undefined method `each' for true:TrueClass (NoMethodError)
Post._content: OK, hopefully this might help someone some time somewhere. If you are getting the error on the title, it's mainly because you are using a changed method on your ActiveRecord model. I was working with an ActiveRecord model that handles an string with quotes, so when trying to save the model, that exception was raised. The problem is that ActiveRecord uses a changed method internally for all attributes that were modified. When you are using a changed method yourself, you are overwriting it, hence the error. In my case: /opt/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.2.2/lib/active_record/base.rb:2808:in `attributes_with_quotes': undefined method `each' for true:TrueClass (NoMethodError) from /opt/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.2.2/lib/active_record/base.rb:2706:in `update_without_lock' Solution, just get rid of your changed method and rename it something else. Also helpful information, here.
Post.raw: title: "lib/active_record/base.rb:2808:in `attributes_with_quotes': undefined method `each' for true:TrueClass (NoMethodError)" date: 2009/2/9 20:49:54 tags: - activerecord - issues - ruby --- OK, hopefully this might help someone some time somewhere. If you are getting the error on the title, it's mainly because you are using a changed method on your ActiveRecord model. I was working with an ActiveRecord model that handles an string with quotes, so when trying to save the model, that exception was raised. The problem is that ActiveRecord uses a changed method internally for all attributes that were modified. When you are using a changed method yourself, you are overwriting it, hence the error. In my case: /opt/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.2.2/lib/active_record/base.rb:2808:in `attributes_with_quotes': undefined method `each' for true:TrueClass (NoMethodError) from /opt/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activerecord-2.2.2/lib/active_record/base.rb:2706:in `update_without_lock' Solution, just get rid of your changed method and rename it something else. Also helpful information, here.

Post.title: Lessons learned and real experience
Post._content: I've been busy. We've been building a next generation video ad serving platform with all of lessons and experience we've gained over the last couple of years and specially over last one. In an industry where there's too much client demand there's only a few key supply players doing a good job and we've identified strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. We've kept ourselves busy. Over the course of last year, especially on the second half and as far as this first quarter of 2012 has been running, aims for a new better product have made me reconsider what I thought I knew and what I thought I had to learn on an engineering point of view, about how to build not only regular or good software, but enterprise software. Having a startup background where dynamics are key, we've shifted into a more concise, long-term, sustainable technology where pieces need not to change easily, but at the same time, provide flexibility, customizable solutions for clients' needs and that would allow us to continue growing. Question for me has been whether all of what I thought I knew about Web dynamics, engineering and technology is what I really thought it was. How do you get to the point where you start using some sort of product to enable you to build another. How is that decision made in your head. What business decisions are made that affect the technology stack on the technology your peers are building, on the product you are taking care of to produce something usable. How are those decisions considered from a technology point of view, are they just passed along and executed or do they really carry along considerations from all points of the company. A modern life Web engineer does not only write software. That person should also understand how the entire business stack works, why are positions covered around him and how are those dots connecting to provide a good solution for some one who pays to use it. The engineer has to understand that very well. It's amazing the amount of strategies that I've personally met and thought of over the time. Real life experience is invaluable, but basic understanding of how things work is what enables that, and some people sometimes seem to forget that. Are you paying overpriced developers because you're using hyped technology? Are you putting enough thought on what you are building and what could lead to in terms of those bricks. It is not a myth that when you learn and increase your knowledge on something, something else seems to open up and leave your mind with more questions. Learning more makes you realize you're ignorant. And it's only the ability and willingness to continue learning that would lead you to a much better thought process that could even eventually make you think that the answer to the question was just right there from the very beginning, from the basics.

Post.title: Leavander Johnson, RIP
Post._content:
Jess Chvez was challenging Johnson’s championship which he won in Italy against Steffano Zoff.

The fight between Johnson and Chvez was stopped on the 11st round by the referee to give Chvez a technical win. Johnson received around three bunches of punches in the last moments the fight without any answer from his side. The referee saw this and stopped the fight. Chvez was the new champion.

The referee and Johnson’s crew asked him if he was OK and he said he was. “I’m only a little bit disappointed”. Chvez was declared new champion and Johnson, in his way to the dressing rooms, started to walk dizzy and collapsed. An ambulance took him to the nearest hospital (in Las Vegas) and, after three hours of surgery, he died because of a brain hemorrhage. He left three sons and his wife. Chvez, apparently was creating a fund to help Johnson’s sons on school, let’s see if that is real and not only a press coverage.

Boxing is a dangerous sport, but it is as dangerous as any other sport can be (I have seen some professional players dying while playing soccer games on TV). Only in this one, two individuals agree to punch each other until one of them gets too stupid to keep on fighting, it’s up to them. I like it, but you know what they say, shit happens.

Post.title: Large PHP scripts truncated on nginx
Post.raw: title: "Large PHP scripts truncated on nginx" date: 2010/2/3 11:35:14 tags: - gzip - javascript - nginx - php - tinymce - wordpress --- I spent a couple of hours yesterday trying to debug an issue that made me hit my head against the wall while it lasted. I run multiple instances of WordPress, and with it, comes a nice little editor bundled called TinyMCE. But on my main WordPress installation (this very blog, dear reader, where you are reading this from), TinyMCE wouldn't come up, it wouldn't render properly on the browser, it didn't matter if it was my main browser, Chrome, or Firefox, Safari, cached, uncached, it was just broken. Since I hadn't have the time to go through this issue before, I was using a different editor installed as a plugin. LAME. And coward. Anyway, I found out that one of the scripts wp-tinymce.php was being returned truncated. Because of that, Firebug would report that some TinyMCE bullshit wasn't defined (JavaScript, oh I'm not very fond of you). Oh, well. I tested calling that script under curl separately and in fact, it was only returning a fraction of the script, 44K out of the actual 200+K. I also found out that even though my nginx installation had gzip compression enabled and the PHP had zlib as well, the script wouldn't process the tinymce.js.gz but it was returning directly tinymce.js. It's alright, I just wanted it to work, no matter if it wouldn't go through gzip, that'd be a matter of some other day. After a lot of googling I ended up reading this blog post (in Portuguese), suggesting to make sure the file permissions for both the client_body_temp and fastcgi_temp directories allowed the user running nginx (www-data in my case) to write in them. Apparently large scripts would start writing to disk on them temporarily while processing the shit. Of course, you wouldn't have this issue if you are running an nginx from your operating system package manager (like Debian's), but this might very well happen when you are running a custom nginx with separate modules and all sorts of crap on top of it: chown www-data:www-data -R /usr/local/nginx/fastcgi_temp/; chmod -R 777 /usr/local/nginx/fastcgi_temp/; chown www-data:www-data -R /usr/local/nginx/client_body_temp/; chmod -R 777 /usr/local/nginx/client_body_temp/; Obrigado, republicavirtual.com.br :-)

Post.title: Ladrones
Post._content:
Los bandidos ya no son como antes.

Apenas el da de ayer me deca mi buen amigo Dolphmef que haba sido vctima de un asalto exprs (lo calific como un secuestro exprs, aunque yo no lo considero de esa manera).

l y otro amigo en comn, Toms, regresaban a media tarde de no-s-dnde. Toms haba ido a dejarlo en su coche hasta su casa -ubicada en Uxmal, en la Col. Narvarte, a escasas 3-4 cuadras de la ma-. En ello, Dolphmef estaba cerrando la puerta de afuera de su casa cuando tres tipos armados los amagaron y los treparon al coche de Toms.

Les bajaron todo lo posible, fueron a un cajero y Toms sac sus escasos 1’700 pesos que tena en su cuenta, su celular, cartera, adems del celular de Dolphmef. Y desde luego, el coche, que me parece que era un Passat.

Los fueron a dejar en Concepcin Bistegui y Tlalpan.

Los ladrones ya no son como antes. Ya no es la bonita tradicin de enmascararse y entrar a una casa con una linterna a media noche y buscar dinero; ahora caen a la hora que sea, tienen mtodos ms sofisticados de trabajar.

Ya no se tientan el corazn. No s a qu se deba este efecto, pero quiz sea, desde luego, el desempleo y la pobre situacin econmica mundial, y ms especfica mexicana.

Qu lstima que se haya perdido la tradicin de robar donde los asaltados se coman una telera para bajar el susto. Qu coraje y qu impotencia lo de Toms y Marco: Dolphmef.

Post.title: 'La Otra Campaa' en el Distrito Federal
Post._content:
El Delegado Zero, Subcomandante Marcos, acompaado de adherentes de La Otra, han entrado a la Zona Metropolitana de la Ciudad de Mxico y se han realizado mtines en la FES Aragn, en CCH Naucalpan y muchos lugares ms (La Otra Campaa en el Estado de Mxico). El contingente iniciar sus actividades dentro del Distrito Federal desde este viernes 28 de abril y durar hasta el jueves 4 de mayo:

Post.title: La insoportable levedad de ser Damog.org
Post._content:
Acabo de ver algo especialmente cagado…

Mientras checaba alegremente las estadsticas de este hermoso y bien ponderado sitio de reunin de mis ms profundos sentimientos y albures chocarreros, vi que Damog.org era visitado por mucha gente que en un motor de bsqueda (como Google, Lycos, o Altavista) buscaba con el criterio: ‘la insoportable levedad del ser’, el cual era el ttulo anterior de este sitio

La duda me abord y visit Google preguntando por resultados con esa misma frase: la insoportable levedad del ser. El cuarto resultado era el que apuntaba a Damog.org… Ahaha… Lo que uno encuentra en la red, buscan literatura, y se encuentran con este servidorcete de medio pelo

Post.title: La importancia de los logs en las charlas
Post._content:
Siempre he dicho que las bitcoras (logs) de programas de conversacin son infinitamente tiles. Incluso, me parece que tengo logs desde hace dos aos, principalmente, del IRC (usando X-Chat) y de los IM’s (usando Gaim).

Sin embargo, ahora quiero postear algo que interesante que pas en el canal #debian-women, de irc.debian.org.

Erinn, conocida como helix, al entrar hoy por la tarde al canal, me pregunt que si yo haba editado su wiki. La verdad es que ni siquiera saba que tena un wiki. Dijo que alguien haba modificado un nombre, de “Juan Luis Guerra”, le haban puesto “Juan Luis Guerra y su 4-40”. Gracioso :-)

El sistema que ella ocupa como wiki est abierto libremente, cualquier persona lo puede editar; sin embargo, pareca molesta pues no publica mucho la URL del wiki, mas que precisamente en el canal de IRC.

Por qu me pregunt que si yo lo haba modificado? Por que encontr que quien lo haba modificado tena una IP mexicana. En fin.

Luego de muchas discusiones y triviales conversaciones, le ped la IP y sto fue lo que hice:

damog@cebollita:~/.xchat2/xchatlogs$ grep ‘201.137.53.118’ *
FreeNode-#debian-mentors.log:Apr 18 20:41:50 —> zarathustra (~zarathust@201.137.53.118) has joined #debian-mentors
FreeNode-#debianmexico.log:Apr 18 20:41:50 —> zarathustra (~zarathust@201.137.53.118) has joined #debianmexico
FreeNode-#debian-women.log:Apr 18 20:41:50 —> zarathustra (~zarathust@201.137.53.118) has joined #debian-women
FreeNode-#debian-women.log:Apr 20 22:33:57 <helix> 201.137.53.118
FreeNode-#unixmexico.log:Apr 18 20:47:15 —> zarathustra (~zarathust@201.137.53.118) has joined #unixmexico
FreeNode-#unixmexico.log:Apr 18 20:51:33 <— zarathustra (~zarathust@201.137.53.118) has left #unixmexico (“Tschss !”)
damog@cebollita:~/.xchat2/xchatlogs$

Lo peor es que zarathustra estaba en el canal cuando estaba la discusin. Le dije a helix que hasta donde yo saba, l y yo ramos los nicos mexicanos en #debian-women. l lo neg.

Finalmente cay, gracias a los logs :-)

Post.title: La hoja se rompi
Post._content:
Se dio cuenta que poda hablarle a las plantas cuando una maana, luego de comer su fruta con yogurt bostez viendo de cerca lo que le llama la atencin en esa violeta: Los finos pelitos que le salen de las hojas. Luego de bostezar, le pareci que la planta en cuestin se estremeca. Le extra y se acerc un poco ms a la planta, concentrado. Pareca que los pelitos de la hoja se levantaban notando la presencia de aquel individuo.

“Oye”, le dijo bajito y los pelitos descendieron. El corazn le di un salto y empez a sudar fro. “Me oyes?”, le susurr y esta vez la planta no hizo nada. Juan volvi a preguntar: “Me oyes?”. La planta movi levemente una hoja ladendola: Era movimiento voluntario, no era movimiento como cuando el viento mueve las plantas, este era movimiento verdadero, que naca de la conciencia de la planta. Conciencia? Tendra conciencia la planta? Finalmente, qu es la conciencia? Las otras plantas estn concientes de que no son ms que plantas?

Juan se acerc un poco ms y toc con sus dedos ndice y pulgar una de las hojas, inmediatamente sinti cmo los pelitos de la violeta le daban pellizquitos. Se senta raro: Tanto l como el hecho de que la violeta reaccionara. “Eres una hija de puta!”, le grit, esperando ver una nueva reaccin. Realmente es hija de alguien? La reproduccin asexual le da un padre y una madre? Se puede considerar hurfana? Tiene tambin cromosomas XX o XY? O podra en realidad tener reproduccin sexual vegetativa?

Una de las hojas de la violeta cay a la tierra de la maceta luego de fracturrsele el tallo por la reaccin al grito. Juan qued estupefacto, le di miedo y se meti a baar intentando olvidar su encuentro con la violeta de la cocina de su mam.

Post.title: La frase del ao
Post._content:
Por cierto, sto no se me poda pasar. Al estar trabajando como un pinche chango en las ltimas semanas, me alej un poco de las noticias. Apenas ayer me enter de sto cuando Raquel y yo estbamos viendo los debates nocturnos televisivos; es la frase del ao:

“(Sobre el desafuero) …tuve que retirarme y perd. Pero 18 meses despus, me desquit cuando gan mi candidato.” -Vicente Fox, presidente de Mxico del 1 de diciembre de 2000 al 1 de diciembre de 2006.

Me quedo sin palabras. No s si reir o llorar, decirle hijo de puta o gran bufn o gran cabrn. No s si sentirme igual de siempre con los presidentes en este pas o tomar las armas. Yo creo que mejor sigo trabajando, estudiando y dedicndome a mi lady, que son las tres prioridades en mi vida :)

Post.title: La Columna.pl #1
Post._content:
La Columna.pl es una columna que estar publicando quincenalmente. Ella, inspirada por la gran cantidad de columnas de Perl que ha escrito Randal Schwartz, tocar diferentes temas y situaciones que principiantes o programadores en Perl pueden enfrentar y que yo personalmente tambin he enfrentado e intento explicar de una forma rpida, concisa y sencilla. Creo firmemente que, una vez digerida una curva pronunciada de aprendizaje, esa experiencia puede moldearse de tal forma que transforme la lnea en lo ms recta posible para gente interesada, para gente que desea conocer ejemplos de la vida real. La Columna.pl de esta semana trata, como su ttulo bien lo apunta, sobre el manejo del tiempo con Perl. El tiempo es algo que no siempre es lo suficientemente intuitivo para trabajar, su propia naturaleza lo hace complejo. Sumar una fecha con otra no es tan sencillo como puede parecer: Hay que tomar en cuenta muchas cosas, los meses con 30 31 das, por ejemplo, los aos bisiestos, incluso si hay un cambio de zonas horarias, pueden ser calculadas con el pasar de los aos. El tiempo es a veces algo confuso cuando se maneja con Perl, pero es slo por apariencia, en realidad es de lo ms sencillo y divertido. Los invito a que estn al pendiente de La Columna.pl, cada quince das, pues pongo esfuerzo, dedicacin y amor en este trabajo, para obtener un producto de calidad que le guste y le sirva a la gente. Naturalmente, le agradezco a mi reina su apoyo en este proyecto, pues ella fue mi inspiracin inicial; y asimismo, le agradezco a Marco Antonio Manzo por sus siempre puntuales observaciones y apoyo para la difusin de Perl. Y desde luego, a merlyn, por servir como modelo a seguir.

http://www.damog.net/columnapl
Post.raw:
title: "La Columna.pl #1" date: 2007/5/21 22:08:40 Tags: --- La Columna.pl es una columna que estar publicando quincenalmente. Ella, inspirada por la gran cantidad de columnas de Perl que ha escrito Randal Schwartz, tocar diferentes temas y situaciones que principiantes o programadores en Perl pueden enfrentar y que yo personalmente tambin he enfrentado e intento explicar de una forma rpida, concisa y sencilla. Creo firmemente que, una vez digerida una curva pronunciada de aprendizaje, esa experiencia puede moldearse de tal forma que transforme la lnea en lo ms recta posible para gente interesada, para gente que desea conocer ejemplos de la vida real. La Columna.pl de esta semana trata, como su ttulo bien lo apunta, sobre el manejo del tiempo con Perl. El tiempo es algo que no siempre es lo suficientemente intuitivo para trabajar, su propia naturaleza lo hace complejo. Sumar una fecha con otra no es tan sencillo como puede parecer: Hay que tomar en cuenta muchas cosas, los meses con 30 31 das, por ejemplo, los aos bisiestos, incluso si hay un cambio de zonas horarias, pueden ser calculadas con el pasar de los aos. El tiempo es a veces algo confuso cuando se maneja con Perl, pero es slo por apariencia, en realidad es de lo ms sencillo y divertido. Los invito a que estn al pendiente de La Columna.pl, cada quince das, pues pongo esfuerzo, dedicacin y amor en este trabajo, para obtener un producto de calidad que le guste y le sirva a la gente. Naturalmente, le agradezco a mi reina su apoyo en este proyecto, pues ella fue mi inspiracin inicial; y asimismo, le agradezco a Marco Antonio Manzo por sus siempre puntuales observaciones y apoyo para la difusin de Perl. Y desde luego, a merlyn, por servir como modelo a seguir.

http://www.damog.net/columnapl

Post.title: La cerveza que reina
Post._content:
Me he dado cuenta que recientemente, sern apenas tres o cuatro meses para ac, la cerveza reina en mi vida.

Ah, qu rica es! Aunque ahora meditndolo un poco, quizs no lo sea. No s, a veces sabe bien, otras veces no.

El pasado jueves estuve en una reunin de Cofrada en la hamburguera Faffa’s. Haba comido nicamente una sopa Maruchan, tena unas incontenibles (que resultaron s contenibles) ganas de defecar que me haca temblar y sudar seco. Llegu al lugar y las ganas haban pasado. Mi esfnter lo resentira ms tarde cuando el excremento se hiciera insostenible y mi frgil clon.

Total, ped una cerveza Victoria -en serio que creo que no haya otra cerveza mejor- y la sent incluso escurrir sobre mi mal cuidada faringe. Era delicioso, cada gota que tomaba era ms deliciosa que la anterior y me supo a oro. Cuando me di cuenta, la pequea botella (de la cual tambin me di cuenta de que son demasiado pequeas, poco lquido) estaba vaca. Esa es la cerveza deliciosa, la que te gusta, la que no necesitas buscarle para encontrar algo. Son como mis deliciosos tenis Converse, an cuando use zapatos, mocasiones, huaraches, botas, etctera, siempre regresar a mis tenis Converse, por que precisamente los uso por que son ya una parte de m. Total que la Victoria es algo as para m.

Mi deliciosa Faffa vegetariana arrib a la mesa y estaba presto a devorarla cuando mi buen amigo Little_Bear, que estaba sentado justo a mi izquierda y quien es ampliamente conocido en burdeles de mala nota y antros con bailarinas exxxticas, adems de su malsana aficin por el chupe, me invit una cerveza Santa F. En el momento me sonaba el nombre, pero no la ubicaba al 100%. El Oso me dijo que era una cerveza excelente, y revir con un: “Falta que el nombre de Santa F sea por la cervecera/restaurante/antro_de_snobs Beer Factory”. La sorpresa fue ma en dos ocasiones. Uno, s era de Beer Factory; dos) Aquello era como una mezcla de cerveza, cebolla y polvo de canela. Demasiado para m. Y realmente no era para m, era una cerveza de lo ms amarga, desabrida dira mi madre.

Uno se queda con lo que es. Cada quien refleja lo que es. Yo soy una Victoria (;-)), aqul es una Indio, y el otro es una Sol oscura -ya luego explicar por qu, en otra ocasin que escriba algunas lneas sobre cervezas, soles, filsofos y sarcasmos-.

Buenas noches.

Post.title: La Asamblea Legislativa en Venezuela y la gente pro-Microsoft
Post._content:
He recolectado una cantidad enorme de ancdotas en el ltimo par de aos debido a los viajes que he hecho al extranjero, que, aunque obviamente no son muchos, he podido recolectar muchos recuerdos y memorias inolvidables sobre muchas de las cosas. De stas, podra contar muchas, de verdad, muchas; muchas, incluso que quizs nunca le cuente a alguien por ser demasiado banales, estpidas o muy personales, o quizs simplemente por falta de tiempo, por geva o por no darle la suficiente importancia. Tambin quizs en los ltimos aos he perdido mucho la capacidad de asombro y muchas cosas, aunque no las haya visto antes jams en mi vida, me parecen normales o rutinarias, quizs el conocimiento global del mundo a travs de Internet ha propiciado esto.

Una de esas ancdotas fue cuando asist con Ana y Jos y mucha ms banda de la comunidad de software libre en Venezuela a la Asamblea Legislativa en donde el diputado Tascn haba convocado a varios sectores de la sociedad para debatir al respecto del software libre, recuerdo que estaba un carnal de IBM; un gey de un software de administracin tributaria usado ampliamente en Venezuela, del que ahorita no logro recordar su nombre; un brasileo que diriga no-s-qu-diantres en Microsoft Venezuela; Felipe Prez Mart, exdirigente de un ministerio venezolano; y Ernesto Hernndez, un cuarto-bate de la comunidad de software libre en Venezuela :).

Los nimos se empezaron a caldear cuando el tipo del software administrativo dijo que Windows era la merma (la neta). lvaro Fuentes, que coordina un esfuerzo de traduccin de software libre a una lengua indgena venezolana, apunt que Microsoft no ofreca la alternativa a los indgenas de usar computadoras por no estar disponible en su lengua nativa. El pendejo le contest diciendo que no importaba porque finalmente slo quedaban 800 ways (creo que as era el nombre de los indgenas). Y as se empez a armar chido, todos los de la comunidad de software libre chingando a ese cabrn, el brasileo de Microsoft simplemente callado, slo di su charla sobre Shared Code y no volvi a abrir la boca.

Lo ms interesante, desde mi punto de vista, fue que as como estaba presente la comunidad de software libre, tambin estaba presente la comunidad pro-Microsoft, en su mayora estudiantes con camisetas de Visual Studio, de .Net, etc. Fue increble para m ver que cuando alguno de los panelistas deca algo en contra del software libre, la comunidad Microsoft se abalanzaba en aplausos y vtores. Y cuando algo se deca contra Microsoft, nosotros lo festejbamos. Incluso hubo algunas ofensivas directas ante ambos grupos. Los pro-Microsoft argumentaban que queran usar lo que ellos quisieran y que el decreto presidencial de Chvez no poda obligarlos a usar forozamente software libre, si a ellos lo que les gustaba y usaban era lo hecho por Microsoft. O sea, WTF?

Finalmente como en casi todas las discusiones de software libre en el mundo, no se lleg a nada y slo se dieron amenazas, sustos, mentadas de madre y finalmente todos terminamos yndonos a casa a soportar la levedad de ser una minora, desde cualquier punto que se vea.

Post.title: Why the Kindle is a piece of shit next to the iPad
Post._content:
The fact that the Amazon Kindle per se exists, has attracted a copious amount of comparisons to the now unveiled Apple iPad. The Kindle of course, is a (reportedly, I don't own one) great e-book reader and Sudoku console. One should be comparing apples to apples, since comparing these two devices is like comparing a Nokia 5110, with an iPhone (ok bigots, or with a NexusOne), simply different times, different action scenarios.

 

I read here or there a tweet from someone saying that given that the iPad is 2x as much as the Kindle, they would be getting a Kindle instead. Of course, this is a big pile of stupidity. First off, let's make clear that the iPad, besides from all of the hype created around it, is much more than just an electronic paper display. Let's compare both devices when I can watch the entire second season of True Blood on the Kindle, seriously. Or let's compare it when you can browse your music library and listen to it while you're replying to your job's email conversations on why Bill, your co-worker on the next cubicle, should throw away his rotten food from the fridge. Or let's just compare the lack of free browsing and/or Wi-Fi connectivity from one of both. Come on.

In spite of the fact that Apple could have made the world go insane by reducing the iPad price by a hundred bucks more, comparing sale prices for the Kindle and the iPad is purely wrong, let's be clear here. But then again, it's just because of the fact that Amazon made a good and popular e-book reader first and started making it successful, why there's such wrong feelings and thoughts about the usefulness of a single feature on Jobs' second coming of Jesus Christ.

But if you still try to compare both, the Kindle will fail miserably. And Amazon could profit from that actually, they can assume their own niche of market and reduce the price to something that would make sense for people to carry such a device instead of the good old book/newspaper commute carrying. Otherwise, it'll leave it as a shitty alternative to the stunning unaffordable Ferrari next door.

Post.title: July 24th, 1958
Post._content:
Today, fifty years ago, my mother was born. On July 24th, 1958, Vicenta Leyva gave birth to Olga Cristina Garza Leyva in the small town of Zumpango del Ro (later renamed to Eduardo Neri), in the southern Mexican state of Guerrero. Her father Guillermo Garza, who is still alive, was a private pilot. Olga Cristina was named Cristina after the saint that is celebrated on the same day. She was their third kid, a couple of years before Vctor and Guillermo were born and a couple of years after, Carlos was born, all of them being born on total different places on southern and central Mexico. The father, being a pilot, was absent from home for long periods, he even had "another family" somewhere in northern Mexico, supposedly in Sinaloa. In the early 60s, the family moved to Mexico City where they were going to spend most of their life. They lived on a small apartment on Col. Moctezuma, which was (and still is) a working class neighborhood, just besides the Mexico City International Airport, on the eastern part of the city. Back in the days, it used to take quite some time to travel from there to any point of the city, like the downtown area or beyond. All the kids spent most of their childhood there attending public schools. They weren't a wealthy family who couldn't even afford to buy and have meat on some days but only in special ocassions. As the years passed and the kids became adults, Olga met David Moreno Rojas in the same neighborhood. He was enrolled at the National Autonomous University of Mexico, under Enterprises Administration in Ciudad Universitaria. He was also an avid ftbol player. He was named David after his father, David Moreno Gonzlez. They became boyfriend and girlfriend and got married when she was 20 and he was 24 years old on December 19th, 1978. They lived together for a few years in Col. Del Valle in central Mexico City. Ten months later they were married, Lorena Moreno Garza, their first kid, was born on October 7th, 1979. S The family then moved to the suburb in Aragon, Estado de Mxico. They had their second child on August 8th, 1984, named David Moreno Garza, becoming David III. After the 1985 Mexico City massive earthquake, the family wanted to move outside the city and found relocation in Ciudad del Carmen, on the Mexican state of Campeche, located on the shore of the Gulf of Mexico, on 1988. They spent three or four years there and then moved to Celaya, Guanajuato where most of the father's family was located. They spent about five years there and then, for family reasons, they returned to Mexico City in 1995 to attend the family business. Olga and her family had a good, loving family by then and had decided to not have any more kids. They had both of their children on private schools and taught them catholicism. On 1998, Vicenta passed away after a quick period of time because of liver cancer. This shocked most of the family. As the years passed, the family business was sold and Olga stopped working, as she used to in the business. But as she had always been very active, she started working as a seller for a fine jewelry firm where she keeps working currently. Her husband, after pursuing his dream of going back to school and studying Law, works as a private work-related issues lawyer. Olga is the most loving, nursing, affective, meticulous, scrupulous person I've ever met and even though I have only met her for almost twenty-four of her fifty years now, I admire her and love her as much as I have no words to describe. She is the one that built my sensitive, loving side where my heart resides, and I thank God for giving me such a great life gift and having her at any time.
Today, her husband is 54, her daughter is 28, her son is 23 and she is 50 now. This is also an special year because she and her husband will celebrate 30 years of their marriage.
Felicidades, jefecita.

He was named David after his father, David Moreno Gonzlez. They became boyfriend and girlfriend and got married when she was 20 and he was 24 years old on December 19th, 1978. They lived together for a few years in Col. Del Valle in central Mexico City. Ten months later they were married, Lorena Moreno Garza, their first kid, was born on October 7th, 1979. S The family then moved to the suburb in Aragon, Estado de Mxico. They had their second child on August 8th, 1984, named David Moreno Garza, becoming David III. After the 1985 Mexico City massive earthquake, the family wanted to move outside the city and found relocation in Ciudad del Carmen, on the Mexican state of Campeche, located on the shore of the Gulf of Mexico, on 1988. They spent three or four years there and then moved to Celaya, Guanajuato where most of the father's family was located. They spent about five years there and then, for family reasons, they returned to Mexico City in 1995 to attend the family business. Olga and her family had a good, loving family by then and had decided to not have any more kids. They had both of their children on private schools and taught them catholicism. On 1998, Vicenta passed away after a quick period of time because of liver cancer. This shocked most of the family. As the years passed, the family business was sold and Olga stopped working, as she used to in the business. But as she had always been very active, she started working as a seller for a fine jewelry firm where she keeps working currently. Her husband, after pursuing his dream of going back to school and studying Law, works as a private work-related issues lawyer. Olga is the most loving, nursing, affective, meticulous, scrupulous person I've ever met and even though I have only met her for almost twenty-four of her fifty years now, I admire her and love her as much as I have no words to describe. She is the one that built my sensitive, loving side where my heart resides, and I thank God for giving me such a great life gift and having her at any time.
Today, her husband is 54, her daughter is 28, her son is 23 and she is 50 now. This is also an special year because she and her husband will celebrate 30 years of their marriage.
Felicidades, jefecita.

Post.title: Julio Csar Chvez, or when the glory is gone
Post._content:
The most valuable Mexican boxing fighter, Julio Cr Chvez (106-6-1), fought yesterday on one of his goodbye presentations, on an event called “Adis Arizona”, in Phoenix.

JC Chvez is not the same he was ten years ago. He’s old (43), he’s slow and lost last night’s fight because of a broken hand in the 5th round. He’s a complete shame, he represents exactly what a great sport player should not do when they reach glory: They should retire when they are in the top, so other cannot use them as stairs after to climb up.

He lost against an mid-ranked american called Grover, “the Punisher” Wiley. Chvez was one of my heros, he had his own SNES game that rocked my youngest days.

The good thins is that his son (Julio Csar Chvez Jr., 22-0) is a very promising young star in the boxing field. He also fought yesterday and KO’ed in the 2nd round.

It was a shame to see JC Chves lose in the independence day weekend.

Post.title: Joke
Post._content:
Found at the Mexico City House Hash Harriers mailing list :)

A man and a woman who had never met before, but were both married to other people, found themselves assigned to the same sleeping room on a transcontinental train. Though initially embarrassed and uneasy over sharing a room, they were both very tired and fell asleep quickly… he in the upper bunk and she in the lower.

At 1:00 AM, the man leaned over and gently woke the woman saying, “Ma’am, I’m sorry to bother you, but would you be willing to reach into the closet to get me a second blanket? I’m awfully cold.”

“I have a better idea,” she replied. “Just for tonight, let’s pretend that we’re married.”

“Wow! That’s a great idea!” he exclaimed.

“Good,” she replied. “Get your own fucking blanket.”

After a moment of silence, he farted.

Post.title: Job offering
Post._content:
A friend of mine is asking me to publish his company's job offering to the wild. I've seen the offer, what they are doing and it's a very, very nice project/opportunity, I wouldn't announce it here on my blog if it wasn't something worthwhile:
Lytix is seeking an experienced software developer with proven ability to produce, understand and critique code in C, Java and JavaScript; Perl and LISP are a plus. He or she should have broad experience working with heterogeneous environments and multiple platforms, including BSD Unix/Linux, LAMP and other relevant F/OSS platforms. Work will initially be project-based, but could evolve quickly into a full-time position. The candidate will be based in Mexico City.
I'd also add: fluent English, both written and spoken is a must. If you are interested, please drop him a line, Diego Villarreal, and avoid putting me in between. :)

Post.title: Job offering: Web data extraction ninja coder
Post._content:
I just posted a gig-based job offering on jobs.perl.org: Description I'm looking for a developer with interest in Web data harvesting and scraping. I'm currently developing a number of projects with this model and I cannot continue doing them alone. You will be a vital part of these fun projects: I usually enjoy doing them, you should be into that too :) You can be anywhere in the world, I don't care as long as results are shown. I'm looking for a long-term partner for this, not a hit & run. Required skills
  • I need you to understand intermediate Perl, OO-design and medium to complex implementations.
  • You need to have a working skillset of regular expressions.
  • Knowledge and understanding of HTTP basics is vital too. I use an HTTP sniffer + Firebug most of the time.
  • A UNIX (Linux or MacOS) background would be a plus.
  • Git is an extra plus. If you are into Subversion, you'd be willing to convert to Git
Desired skills Perl modules mostly used: WWW::Mechanize, LWP::UserAgent (good understanding of it, to extend Mech), HTML::TreeBuilder, HTML::Parser (and its descents), CGI::Fast, Modern::Perl, Moose (beginning to move most of our codebase to real OO), Module::Install, Module::Pluggable and sometimes cool stuff like Catalyst, HTTP::Engine and mod_perl 2. If you are interested, or know someone that might be, please let me know.

Post.title: JAWS links gadget
Post._content:
Pues por fin he termino el primer release :P de mi famossimo links gadget. Este gadget es un mdulo en el cual se pueden dar de alta nuestros enlaces favoritos poniendo el nombre del sitio, la URL y una breve descripcin. JAWS, pensado como un blog personal permite este tipo de gadgets como un plus ms, para los visitantes y conocer por medio de enlaces favoritos, al blogger :P Entremos en materia. Hay cinco partes en que se divide el gadget.

  1. Mdulo de administracin.
  2. Template para el despliegue del gadget.
  3. Imagen para ponerse en el Control Panel.
  4. Template para la administracin del gadget.
  5. Insercin en SQL (insercin en ‘registry’ y creacin de tabla).
Los tres primeros archivos se encuentran ya acomodados en este tarball. Se tiene que desempaquetar en el directorio ‘raiz’ de JAWS (en mi caso personal es /home/damogar/www): 
$ cd $JAWS

$ wget http://www.damog.net/files/links-gadget.tar.gz

$ tar xzvf links-gadget.tar.gz
Al desempaquetarlo, se van a acomodar los archivos necesarios para el gadget:
  • ‘links.php’ dentro de $JAWS/gadgets/
  • ‘admin.links.html’ dentro de $JAWS/templates/controlpanel/
  • ‘links.png’ dentro de $JAWS/images/gadgets/
  • ‘links.html’ dentro de $JAWS/templates/
Recalco: Mientras el tarball se desempaquete en el directorio raz de JAWS, no es necesario mover manualmente los archivos. Listo, ya tenemos acomodados los archivos. Lo siguiente ser lidiar un poco con la base de datos: 
mysql> INSERT INTO registry VALUES (38,'/gadgets/links/enabled','true');
Aqu podemos sustituir el valor del ‘38’ por el del siguiente del ltimo registro de la tabla ‘registry’. Tip: Por default, JAWS tiene 34 registros en esa tabla (pero lo puedes checar con ‘SELECT * FROM registry’). Despus simplemente creamos la tabla que estar destinada al gadget: 
mysql> CREATE TABLE link (user_id int(11), link varchar(255), url varchar(255), description blob);
Y listo. Por default, el user_id de cada insercin de datos, se hace como ‘0’, el user_id del administrador. Claro, se puede ver el gadget en accin aqu. Cualquier comentario u observacin, hganmela saber.

Post.title: It's not as simple as a matter of choice
Post._content:
MJ, in 3rd world countries, some things like technology, travelling or taking care of the environment are not a matter of choice, unfortunately. When some of the basic needs for humans to live are easily covered and people do not have to worry about, suchs as daily eating, it’s way more easy to develop a country and have people concerning about unimportant stuff. Even free software is a luxury matter on some countries! You know, human beings have an stupid custom acquired since they were born, most of them, and that’s the need for eating, how weaks!

I think you get my point.

Yours, an international traveller flying between the UK.

Post.title: Is GitHub really necessary for your startup engineering team?
Post._content: For the last few months, I've been ranting a little too much with our engineering team about GitHub. These rantings, of course, didn't come out of the blue. I haven't been too satisfied with GitHub's reliability lately since we use it for our daily development and constant deployment on our different staging environments and our own operation has been affected by their recent multiple technical difficulties. This has led me to analyze whether we really need them, why we started paying for their service in the first place and if it's really necessary for our product development in the first place. Being an startup that originated its main product on Ruby and Ruby on Rails, some of our initial engineers were more oriented towards Ruby and open source technologies. We started using GitHub because it was the natural and de facto choice. Creation of repositories and private contributors was easy and would put you up to speed with collaboration. As we grew in developers count, our repositories did too as well as different projects. We even brought a system administrator in place. Do we still need GitHub right now? I won't be dropping Git as our main version control system, but what has GitHub provided my company and project in exchange for the $200 we are paying them every month? Is it only hype for a company to use it for their internal repositories? Or is it hype to use them for their open repositories? The lack of site reliability on their side is what has led me thinking about whether we should still use them. What really concerns me is that they seem to have operational issues on a daily basis, they're constantly announcing new hires, new pub meetings and new Octocat designs, and little effort has been shown about the technical operations. It sometimes amazes me how people is so much in love with GitHub to the point where I even find "liked" articles on their feed on Google Reader whenever they announce downtimes and br0kenage (now +1's). It's like people enjoy what's wrong. Are we using their issues functionality? The nice thread comments per commit, per line? Are we using pull requests? Are we using any of their actual offering compared to what a native Git server setup offers? No. The only thing is just pretty much the collaboration management, and even then, the "Groups" feature per organization is still lacking. The only main feature we use is the web browsing for the repos, which we can do with open source tools anyway. At the end, there's other great GUIs for Git we also use on a daily basis, such as GitX or Tower (and for now, yes, GitHub's GUI client). The issue they were attacked with last week makes me wonder whether they are the right organization to give us version control system services or we're just using them because we haven't know any better or even looked at our own resources (people and machines). Someone got commit access to an open source repository. What if it would have been a malicious user getting access to private repositories where passwords and other sensitive are stored? How serious is this company? $200 is not much for a startup to spend on a neat service, but when that provider seems to be more concerned about stickers or beer than fixing their tech operations from the inside out is when it gets worrying. I like to see how other similar services we're using compare to GitHub, how stable they feel and how notorious that reliability is shown. For example, New Relic which we also use, seems rock solid and they don't show issues at all. What's the difference here anyway? Site reliability is tricky anyway: when it's faulty, it shows and screams because it affects business operations and reaches the entire company; when it's working perfectly, the way it should, you can barely realize people are doing an stupendous job. GitHub, however, doesn't seem to have this clear.

It seems that most of the apps around require iTunes (like iSproggler), but I’d love to do it with a simple script run on a console (and the iTunesDB propietary binary files happens to be a PITA).

Because of lack of time, if nothing exists on that at the moment, I’d be glad to offer a bounty for such app.

Post.title: Invitacin al curso-taller, El derecho a la informacin en Mxico, de Alternativa.
Post._content:
En esta etapa de construccin del partido en Alternativa DF consideramos indispensables adquirir como militantes las herramientas bsicas para el seguimiento de la funcin de los poderes pblicos, que nos den parmetros para la elaboracin de un discurso y agenda poltica de vanguardia. Les invitamos al:

CURSOTALLER

EL DERECHO A LA INFORMACIN EN MXICO

Das: Tres sesiones. Viernes 25 de agosto, 1 y 8 de septiembre

Hora: 16:00 -18:00 hrs

Lugar: Alternativa DF, Palermo 12 Col. Amricas Unidas (Metro Nativitas)

Dirigido a: Simpatizantes e integrantes de Alternativa

Objetivo: Los participantes conocern los principios bsicos de transparencia y acceso a la informacin pblica que facilitarn la comprensin y aplicacin de la ley de transparencia tanto federal y local, como una herramienta para ejercer la ciudadana. Asimismo conocern el funcionamiento de los mecanismos para solicitar informacin gubernamental a partir del estudio de un caso concreto que ellos mismos desarrollarn.

Metodologa: Se realizarn 3 sesiones en las que los ponentes presentarn los conceptos bsicos sobre la transparencia y su utilidad para la consolidacin de un estado democrtico. As mismo ser necesaria la particin de los integrantes del grupo.

Cupo Mximo: 25 personas.

Inscripciones: A partir del 14 de agosto. Enviar nombre y telfono a los siguientes correos para realizar inscripcin: luceronoem@yahoo.com, alternativadf@alternativa.org.mx.

Responsables: Noem Ramrez Lucero y Jess Robles Maloof.

PROGRAMA

Viernes 25 de agosto 16:00 -18:00 hrs

  • El poder de la informacin. Definiciones bsicas sobre el derecho a la informacin, transparencia y rendicin de cuentas.
  • A qu informacin tenemos derecho?, Ley de transparencia y acceso a la informacin publica gubernamental.
  • Un acercamiento al IFAI Qu es el IFAI?
Viernes 1 de agosto 16:00 -18:00 hrs
  • La transparencia en el Distrito Federal, discurso o realidad
  • La rendicin de cuentas en rganos autnomos, casos de estudio: La Asamblea Legislativa del Distrito Federal y el Instituto Electoral del D.F
  • La Transparencia y los partidos polticos. Un reto para Alternativa

TALLER

Viernes 8 de septiembre 16:00 -18.00 hrs

  • Cmo ejercer el derecho a la informacin?, Herramientas para exigir el derecho a la informacin, Introduccin al SISI y al SAI

Post.title: Introducing Feedbag: Feed auto-discovery Ruby library/tool
Post._content:
Last week, I spent some time building a good (that I liked) feed auto-discovery tool to use in Ruby for other project I'm building, rFeed. I liked CPAN's Feed::Find, and at some point I made a wrapper class to run a Perl script using such module, however, I wasn't happy by mixing it all. So, Feedbag was born: 
>> require "rubygems"
=> true
>> require "feedbag"
=> true
>> Feedbag.find "log.damog.net"
=> ["http://feeds.feedburner.com/TeoremaDelCerdoInfinito", 
 "http://log.damog.net/comments/feed/"]
>> planet_feeds = Feedbag.find("planet.debian.org")
[ ... ]
>> planet_feeds.first(3)
=> ["http://planet.debian.org/rss10.xml", 
 "http://planet.debian.org/rss20.xml", 
 "http://planet.debian.org/atom.xml"]
>> planet_feeds.size
=> 104
>>
It makes smart use of relative and absolute bases, hrefs, links, content types, etc. It is also a single Ruby file, so you can grab it and use it on your application. Plus, it only requires Hpricot as dependency. It can find all feeds linked on a web page, but it will return the most important at the beginning of the resulting array, so you will have the important one on the first results (see example above with Planet Debian). Synopsis, README and a brief tutorial have been placed at axiombox.com/feedbag. You can also take a look at the git repo, hosted in GitHub.

Post.title: Introducing Apache2::EmbedFLV  Exposing FLVs with Flowplayer and a customized interface
Post._content:
Situation You have a bunch of Flash videos, FLV files. Every once in a while you dump new files on your publicly accessible Apache directory. You would like to give your users the ability to play those FLVs within a webpage you provide, instead of just serving them the files for a direct download. Maybe you want this for all FLVs, not only an specific directory. Solution Apache2::EmbedFLV! 
<Files ~ "\.flv$">
  SetHandler modperl
  PerlResponseHandler Apache2::EmbedFLV
</Files>
So now, all your FLV files will be served through Apache2::EmbedFLV on mod_perl with a neat interface you can define yourself, and using the very nice and GPL'ed Flowplayer. Apache2::EmbedFLV uses a default template, but you can define your own with: 
<Files ~ "\.flv$">
  SetHandler modperl
  PerlSetVar template /path/to/your/template.tt
  PerlResponseHandler Apache2::EmbedFLV
</Files>
Also, Apache2::EmbedFLV expects to find Flowplayer (flowplayer.swf and flowplayer.controls.swf) on http://your.server.com/flowplayer.swf, the root of your server. So you can do something like this to make it work: 
Alias /flowplayer.swf /home/web/flowplayer/flowplayer.swf
Alias /flowplayer.controls.swf /home/web/flowplayer/flowplayer.controls.swf
Or, you just define the flowplayer variable: 
<Files ~ "\.flv$">
  SetHandler modperl
  # relative to the document root
  PerlSetVar flowplayer /swf/flowplayer.swf
  # or absolute:
  PerlSetVar flowplayer http://my.other.server/was/hacked/flowplayer.swf
  PerlResponseHandler Apache2::EmbedFLV
</Files>
Action! You can see it in action at http://axiombox.com/apache2-embedflv/flv. This Radiohead video is particularly cool :-) Getting it
  • More information at its homepage, http://axiombox.com/apache2-embedflv
  • CPAN module.
  • Git repository, as usual, on GitHub.
UPDATE: Oops! Fixed link to Flowplayer's website! flowplayer.org. Thanks to those who noticed and let me knew.

Post.title: Injured
Post._content:
Im injured. Yesterday, Raquel and me were fooling around and playing, so in the middle of the play, I knelt down, grabbed her legs and put her lap on my left shoulder in order to lift her. So I did.

After carrying her and she screaming put me down!, I tried to avoid her from hitting some thing on the ceiling, so I bent to one side wildly, with her still on my shoulder and back and then I felt an awful jab and pain on my back and the whole thorax started to hurt. So, I asked Raquel, who was already safe on ground, to press my thorax in a way to stop pain. It didnt work out. As we were on our way to the supermarket, driving was painful, even lifting my arms, heavy breathing, etc. When we came back home, I laid in bed for resting and TV watching, but most of my moves were still painful: around 3 hours after the first pain.

I could barely sleep, I couldnt stay on the same position for a while, but had to change to some other, and it was still painful. At around 3 am, I could sleep a bit better. When I woke up at 7, the pain was still there, but it wasnt that hard; she woke up and went to the gym. So, Im resting in bed with a back pain, on a Monday morning. Raquel went to the office after she came back and I feel like an old grandpa.

I will only go see the doctor if the pain is not handleable by tomorrow morning, otherwise I will only spend money that we dont currently have on drugs and on the doctors invoice, and I dont want to; as stupid as this may seem, I dont trust doctors. I hope I will be OK by tomorrow and ready to leave to DebConf on Saturday morning.

Post.title: Infinite Pig Theorem!
Post._content:
So, I have finally moved my blog to MovableType from Wordpress and a couple of interesting things have happened:

  • I’ve gave birth to my new blog, Infinite Pig Theorem.
  • I’ve started Blog::Normalize as an entirely i-don’t-give-too-much-shit-if-people-disagree-so-beat-it-dude project. You can import posts to MovableType from Wordpress as the time of writing which was my whole purpose at first, but then expanded the idea.

It feels good to be back.
Post.raw:
title: "Infinite Pig Theorem!" date: 2008/2/24 18:28:00 Tags: ---

So, I have finally moved my blog to MovableType from Wordpress and a couple of interesting things have happened:

  • I’ve gave birth to my new blog, Infinite Pig Theorem.
  • I’ve started Blog::Normalize as an entirely i-don’t-give-too-much-shit-if-people-disagree-so-beat-it-dude project. You can import posts to MovableType from Wordpress as the time of writing which was my whole purpose at first, but then expanded the idea.

It feels good to be back.

Post.title: Independence Day
Post._content:
Today, actually yesterday (September 16th), was Mexican Independence Day. A day like today, almost 200 years ago, 1810, Mexicans began their way to freedom. This year also, it is the 150th birthday of the Mexican Anthem, composed by Bocanegra and Nun.

Obviously, that day is, nowadays, an excuse for drinking and celebrating. I really didn’t do anything on the eve. I stayed at home working on several things. I remembered, one year ago, ion came to Mexico City, from Chihuahua, and I took him to a party I was invited, stupidly far away from here, near to the exit to Cuernavaca, a city 80 km to the south of the city. That was one of the worst parties ever.

Anyway, happy anniversary, free Mexico. ;-)

So, today was a holiday and nobody does anything on September 16th, so Raquel and I went to the movies. We watched La Mala Educacin by Pedro Almodvar. That is a wild film, pretty cool, crude, rude, gay, twisted. A great movie, who else can make movies like Almodvar? And the funny part: Gael Garca Bernal speaking Spanish accent all the time ;-)

So, tomorrow, because of today’s holiday lots of people do not work neither. They take the jump holiday, but I’m working tomorrow, besides, I couldn’t stand being on my house all day long.

There is no money anymore, so I think this weekend will be a calmed down one.

Current Mood: exhausted
Current Music: The 5, 6, 7, 8’s - Bomb the Twist

Post.title: In Madrid
Post._content:
I just arrived Madrid around 12 hours ago, after a 11-hour long flight.

I thought thetimezone change wouldn’t affect me since I used to think changing timezones was like going out for party and get back at home late (for example, 6 am :-), but hell no. I arrived 6 am, and by 9:30 I was already sleeping like a baby completely tired.

The bad thing: I’m now 7 hours older :-(

The good thing: Right now, 7 pm is almost time to party and drink with the guys. At Mexico City, I would be working right nowon midday :-)

The ugly thing: Obviously everything seems to be more much expensive than what I thought.

But hey, it is very nice over here. I’m staying with a friend of mine who is studying here in Madrid, her mother sent her a backpack with clothes, candies and tortillas and chilli. :-D

Post.title: In Finland
Post._content:
My father warned me: ‘Be careful with the Paris-CDG airport, it is a madness thing’.

I was thinking: ‘My old man is now too old-fashioned for this time’.

He was completely right. I almost lost my Paris-Helsinki flight due disorganization on that airport, nobody knew what the gate was, or when the plane was leaving. When somebody told me I had to be at terminal 2D I was a running like a crazy, to not lose the flight, from a terminal to another. Finally get there, and the signs are confusing. I saw a screen and tried to find the Helsinki flight. Nothing. Finally asked in the information desk: Gate 74. Geez.

Upstairs? No, go downstairs, look at the watch, please do not lose the flight. It has been already 30 minutes since the boarding time and 15 missing for the plane to leave. Arrived gate 74 of terminal 2D, after a complete security check that even asked me to take my shirt off (the aduana was even lighter). Show my boarding pass (already given to me in Mexico City airport) to the lady. ‘Sorry sir, this flight is leaving to Florence’. ‘What? They told me 74 was my gate’. ‘No, see the screen, this gate is leaving to Florence’ (Starting to feel unconfortable and said some bad words to her in Spanish). ‘So, what is my gate?’. She checked on the computer and said: ‘Sorry, I have not that information’. More bad words in Mexican Spanish.

Next gate. Show the boarding pass, ‘sorry, this gate is for Milan, London, !Helsinki, !Helsinki, !Helsinki’. Asked again in an information desk. ‘Where the bloody shit is my gate for this boarding pass, Madam?’. She did not understood my very bad and poor English, I guess so she pointed me with other guy. After reading the boarding pass information: ‘Try gate 80, sir’. ‘Try? Are you fucking kidding me?’. On my way to gate 80, I showed the pass to the lady on that gate. ‘Yes, sir, this is the gate’. Geez, finally. ‘Do you have your coupon?’, ‘coupon? What bloody coupon? I don’t know, take all my papers and let me go’. ‘I cannot let you go in unless you have a coupon’. Shit. Showed all my papers, even my old passport. I was getting more angry and she was upset because of my mood, also. Finally appeared, is the ticket a coupon? If not, it is for her.

10 seconds later, I was already on the bus that took the last four passengers to the plane. 5 minutes more it closed doors. 7 minutes later, the plane was moving.

Is it normal this thing on Paris-CDG? Maybe it is only a bad experience, but it made me (it still does) mad. Paris would be great for a tourist visit, but no for losing a connection flight. And I didn’t even see the Eiffel Tower 8-)
